author: Kalhiki
title: Red Saber-tooth Elephant Gorrila of Death!
review:
I've had Raw-Jaw for a while now, so I guess it's better late than never for a review of him.

Box/Instructions

The box, like all the other packagings is a nice lime green color. Raw Jaw looks particularly menacing (and bulky) as he stands on a large techno-organic tree branch. In the background there are also some other Raw Jaws crawling around. The back of the box has him fighting Bulk 3.0, and beside that picture is a short comic depicting what all is going on.

The instructions are as usual and not really worth getting into. Besides, there are more important things that come in the box.

Parts

The parts in this set are actually pretty good. First of all you get a nice assortment of red bones and cladding. As for reused parts he comes with a size 5 cladding piece with some excellent printing on it (mold has been used, but the printing is new). And he also comes with some red Ben 10 feet, which I like. I'm wanting to see this piece more widely used.

New pieces include the tusks, large red shells (don't know what to call these. same piece as Stringer's weapon), red paws, Quaza spike, those little black spikey pieces (on his hands and tail), and the head. Since the head can only be found in this set, I'll only go over it. It's a very detailed design, but I'm not really getting a gorilla vibe off of it. To me it looks more like a saber tooth cat with those big fangz (heh heh, see what I did there?... I guess it would be funnier if I was actually reviewing Fangz...)

Minifigures

none. Sadly. It would be fun to make Raw Jaw eat them.

The build

The build was rather simplistic. Despite not being humanoid in appearance, it still followed the same pattern. After all, animals are just humanoids on all fours. However, he does have some differences to set him apart. For instance, his back and head assembly. I guess you could include the arms just due to the bulk they have.

The completed model

I really do like this figure. He may be small, but he has a lot of heft to him. The added layer in the body makes him decently thick, and the arms just look like they could pound something to a pulp. Speaking of the arms, he has some nice fingers which are articulated for a number of poses. I also like the fact how he was given armor on his underside. Since it's really out of view, it doesn't seem necessary, but it's a good addition.

Now, of course, every set can't go by without problems. Let's start with the tail. Let's face it, this thing is dinky. Sure it's poseable, but it just looks thin in the middle and the cladding at the end makes it look weird. At least they tried to bulk it up with the black spikey piece.

My only other complaint would be his mouth. Yes his name is Raw-JAW, and yes, he does have a jaw that can open and close. But it's tiny. I would have liked some other mouth design that could bulk up that lower jaw.

Summary

Overall, I highly recommend you pick this guy up. He may be a little short (shorter than a Hero even), but his bulk makes up for that. I feel he could easily take down a Hero. Raw Jaw is fun to play with and pose, and I don't think you'll be dissapointed if you pick him up.

5/5 highly recommended.

author: YahooXD
title: A simple but fun-to-have set...with Copyright?!
review:
Simply put, the one only reason why I did this "review" was because of the oddly familiar mask. Petty much any EarthBound/Mother fan like myself would easily recognize its face to the series' most famous character; Giygas.

With the bright red color scheme and detail on the mouth (three small teeth and the rest of the mouth drooping down,) is already obvious enough, but then the fact that it's supposed to be an immense beast closes the case.

Coincidence, LEGO Group?

author: Rocka_3_0
title: Raw-Jaw, AKA Roger
review:
I just got Raw-Jaw, or Roger as I like to call him, for my B-day, and I thought I'd review him for you guys!

Pros

1. Awesome pieces

2. Great set for mocing

3. Can get some epic poses out of 'em

4. Face and tusks look really cool

Cons

1. Face looks sad in some angles.

2. Tusks are a little bit long.

 

I really like Roger and I want you to buy him and see for yourself!
